main event: Various reports of an anomalous luminous phenomena, identified as a meteor, were documented on March 6, 1951.
interesting points: The event was observed by four Los Alamos personnel and two Kirtland AFB pilots,The meteor was described as a very bright object crossing the sky,Dr. Lincoln LaPaz conducted an investigation into the phenomenon with no fragments recovered,The incident is deemed the second-largest of its kind following notable fireballs in earlier years,Investigations continue to determine whether physical evidence of meteoritic material exists.
witness description: four Los Alamos personnel and two Kirtland AFB pilots
